title: The red carpet is champagne-colored this year. But why was it red in the first place?
description:
• Full list of Oscar nominees
• Inside the making of an Oscar statuette
• Video: The weird way Oscar votes are counted
• #OscarsSoMale? Women shut out of the directing category

title: Officials confirm identity of Ukrainian prisoner of war who was executed on camera
Where to watch the Oscars
North Korea fires 2 missiles from submarine, state media reports
description: North Korea fired two missiles from a submarine off the coast in the waters of the Sea of Japan on Sunday morning local time, according to the state-run news agency KCNA.

title: US regulators bail out SVB customers, who can access all their money Monday
description: [Breaking news]

title: Best red carpet fashion at the 2023 Oscars
description: One of 2023's most anticipated nights of fashion is finally here.

title: Expert on SVB collapse: I would advocate that all depositors get their money out of the bank
description: Gary Cohn, the previous director of the National Economic Council under former President Donald Trump, discusses the Silicon Valley Bank collapse and why depositors have found it challenging to withdraw their money.

title: Jenna Ortega remakes '90s classic on 'SNL'
description: "Wednesday" star Jenna Ortega hosted "Saturday Night Live" for the first time and did a remake of a scene from "The Parent Trap" with co-star Fred Armisen.

title: At least 8 dead after boat capsizes in San Diego County, California
description: At least eight people have died after a panga boat capsized near the shore of Black's Beach in San Diego County, California, officials said.

title: Record-strength Cyclone Freddy pounds Mozambique after making second landfall
description: Cyclone Freddy battered central Mozambique on Sunday after making landfall for a second time in a month, breaking records for the duration and strength of tropical storms in the southern hemisphere.

title: Warren issues statement after her comments on Harris
description: A local Boston radio interview with Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) infuriated many in Vice President Kamala Harris' circle. To them, it's the latest snub of the vice president by a fellow Democrat. CNN senior reporter Edward-Isaac Dovere has more.

title: Why did Pence wait until now to rebuke Trump? WSJ reporter weighs in
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence made his most blistering comments yet about former President Donald Trump's role in the January 6 attack on the US Capitol during remarks at the annual Gridiron Club Dinner in Washington, DC.

title: US calls Iran's claim of a prisoner swap deal a 'cruel lie'
description: Biden administration officials on Sunday sharply denied Iranian claims that a prisoner swap deal had been reached.

title: Treasury secretary rules out bailout for Silicon Valley Bank
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Sunday ruled out a federal bailout for Silicon Valley Bank following its spectacular collapse last week.

title: What's the next Silicon Valley Bank — and how can the US prevent more chaos?
description: Silicon Valley Bank failed in rapid, stunning fashion Friday. This week, the tech and banking sector are growing skittish about the next shoe to drop.

title: Ukraine's foreign minister compares Bakhmut offensive to a thief breaking into a house
Watch 'SNL' spoof Oscars pre-show in cold open
description: "Saturday Night Live" brings us the Oscars red carpet and its newest changes.

title: 'Fearless' Steph Curry inspires Golden State Warriors to victory against Milwaukee Bucks
description: Time and time again, Steph Curry has proved his quality, carving out a place among the sport's greats.

title: Half a million Israelis join latest protest against Netanyahu's judicial overhaul - organizers
description: Half a million Israelis took to the streets in the tenth consecutive week of protests against plans by the government of Benjamin Netanyahu to overhaul the country's judicial system, organizers claimed.

title: South African rapper Costa Titch dies after video surfaces of him collapsing on stage
description: South African rapper Costa Titch died suddenly this weekend, his family said on Instagram, hours after performing at a music festival.

title: Opinion: Nikki Haley went there on Social Security
description: When Frances Perkins became the first woman to serve in a president's Cabinet in 1933, she knew her role wouldn't be easy.

title: US banks sitting on unrealized losses of $620 billion
description: Silicon Valley Bank's collapse last week sent tingles of panic down investors' spines as it highlighted a larger problem across the banking sector: The widening gap between the value large lenders place on the bonds they hold and what they're actually worth on the market.

title: As Trump embarks on 2024 journey, some longtime allies go their own way
description: As Donald Trump's onetime campaign manager and a New Hampshire resident, Corey Lewandowski has been by the former president's side for many of his trips to the Granite State. But when Trump traveled to the state in late January, Lewandowski declined an invitation to appear at the event, a source with direct knowledge told CNN.

title: Ukraine FM compares Bakhmut offensive to house break-in
Women can now swim topless in Berlin's swimming pools. The move reflects Germany's tradition of nudity
description: Women in Berlin can now swim topless in the city's public pools if they choose to -- just as men can.

title: Emma Raducanu takes impressive victory at Indian Wells but still isn't 'pain free'
description: Emma Raducanu secured back-to-back victories for the first time since September as she advanced to the third round at Indian Wells on Saturday, but the youngster says she still isn't "pain free" after a series of injuries and illnesses derailed the start of her season.

title: How 'ma'am' went from being a respectful word for some -- but polarizing for others
description: An unexpected rainstorm. A traffic jam on your morning commute. Realizing you forget to put on deodorant.

title: Democratic leaders want the party to stop its Kamala Harris pile-on ahead of 2024
description: Elizabeth Warren has called twice to apologize. Over a month later, Kamala Harris hasn't called back.

title: Saudi oil giant Aramco becomes latest energy firm to post record profits
description: Saudi Arabian oil giant Aramco on Sunday reported a record annual net profit of $161.1 billion for 2022, up 46% from the year earlier, on higher energy prices, increased volumes sold and improved margins for refined products.

title: The new normal on Twitter: watching it break
description: Late last year, Dan Sinker found himself in a "Groundhog Day" situation. When he would check his notifications tab on Twitter, Sinker, who has tens of thousands of followers, often saw the platform recommend the same weeks-old tweet from another user. As Sinker described the situation in one tweet in early December, "we're back to November 7 in my mentions again."

title: Texas state health officials report missing radiographic camera but say risk of radioactive exposure is 'very low'
description: A radiographic camera containing radioactive material has gone missing in Houston, Texas, officials said Saturday.

title: Russian wives and mothers call on Putin to stop sending mobilized men 'to the slaughter'
description: A group of Russian wives and mothers have called on President Vladimir Putin to stop sending their husbands and sons "to the slaughter" by forcing them to join assault groups without adequate training or supplies.

title: Incredible aerial image shows yacht in low tide. The world's largest mermaid convention. The week in 37 photos
Fox hunting club that first met in the 1700s holds last meet after new law
description: One of Scotland's oldest fox hunts has come to an end after 252 years following the introduction of new law on hunting.

title: US authorities seized smuggled artifacts that were stolen from Ukraine -- and returned them where they belong
description: Six months after US authorities in New York seized three metal swords and a stone axe head that had been stolen from Ukraine, the cultural artifacts were returned to the people they belong to.

title: China's new defense minister is a general the US sanctioned for buying Russian weapons
description: China on Sunday appointed a US-sanctioned general as its new defense minister.

title: After a tragic shipwreck, no peace for the dead or living
description: Two weeks after a boat packed with migrants sank off the coast of southern Italy, there is still no peace for the living or the dead, and the missing -- mostly children -- continue to wash up on the beaches.

title: Pence says 'history will hold Donald Trump accountable' for January 6
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence made his most blistering comments yet about former President Donald Trump's role in the January 6 attack on the US Capitol during remarks Saturday evening at the annual Gridiron Club Dinner in Washington, DC.

title: BTS agency HYBE ends takeover battle for K-pop pioneer SM Entertainment
description: BTS agency HYBE says it has called off a takeover bid for SM Entertainment, ending weeks of corporate mudslinging that has dominated headlines in South Korea.

title: World's most expensive housing market faces a critical question
description: Behind the gleaming skyscrapers and multimillion-dollar homes that have made this city the world's most expensive property market lies a far less attractive parallel reality: one of the world's seemingly most intractable housing crises.

title: Iran arrests more than 100 people over suspected poisonings of schoolgirls
description: Iran has arrested more than 100 people "in connection with" the suspected poisoning of hundreds of schoolgirls across the country, according to the state-run IRNA news agency.
